page.title: 12Hollingthorpe Colliery
page.content: The colliery has three shafts the deepest was 140 metres.It was working from 1850-1886.The engine house for the deepest shaft is still in existance,now comprising of two cottages opposite Hollingthorpe Hall.{ {Bolton Wife Colliery.}This colliery closed in the 50's after working for 70 years.The shaft was sunk to a depth of 32 metres when the colliery closed the shaft wasn't filled in but bricked up.Evidence can be found on Bolton Wife Hill beacause there is a mound in the field near Hollingthorpe Lane.{ {Crigglestone Colliery.}The shafts were sunk in 1898 to the Woodmoor seam at a depth of 55 metres.This colliery was known as Wollen Well.
